item_blurb: Public comments will be heard at 9:00 am for items not on the agenda, for no more than 30 minutes. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers will be given up to 3 minutes. For those unable to attend the early comment period, there may be additional comment time available later in the day. Note: Comments made during the general public comment period regarding matters pending before the Commission do not become part of the official record for those matters.

subitem_title: Update on NOAA 312 Evaluation and Site Visit

(MJ-SF)

subitem_title: Presentation from the League of Cities on future coordination and collaboration with the Commission. Informational only.

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.

subitem_title: City of Trinidad LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-TRN-17-0072-1 (CalFire)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Trinidad’s to amend the certified land use plan to allow for an extension of water service from the City to the Trinidad California Dept. of Forestry and Fire Protection Station at 923 Patrick’s Point Drive located outside both the designated urban and service area boundaries of the City’s LUP. (MBK-A)

subitem_title: County of Humboldt LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-HUM-17-0066-1 (CalFire)

(MBK-A)

subitem_title: Application No. 1-16-0899 (California Department of Transportation (Caltrans), Mendocino Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of Caltrans to conduct geotechnical investigation to provide data for siting and design of future rehabilitation/replacement of Highway 1 Albion River Bridge involving geotechnical drilling of up to nine 70-125-ft.-deep bore holes within 6 specified sites, removal of major vegetation and grading for placement of drill rigs and construction of temporary access routes to boring sites, conducting seismic refraction surveys, and replanting cleared areas adjacent to Highway 1, on both sides of the Albion River, Albion, Mendocino County (TG-A)

item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development. (CT-SF)

(SV-LB)

(131 cu.yds. cut and 331 cu.yds. fill) for re-compaction, site preparation, and construction of swimming pool; and addition of 6-ft. high, 224-ft. retaining wall, with pile foundation along northern, western, and southern portion of residentially zoned vacant lot, at 1543 Calle Patricia, Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. subitem_blurb: Application of County of Los Angeles, Beaches and Harbors to expand Dockweiler State Beach RV Park to accommodate 19 campervan spaces along surface asphalt loop road at Dockweiler State Beach, Playa del Rey, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (MA-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-17-0880 (The Beach Club of Santa Monica, Santa Monica)
subitem_blurb: Application of The Beach Club of Santa Monica to renovation, add and remodel the Beach Club facility, including: 1) renovation and remodel of 2 kitchen areas and existing bar and seating area; 2) remodel and addition of maintenance facilities and employee service facilities; 3) extension of current roofline to enclose area renovated to include maintenance and employee service facilities; 4) seismic retrofitting; 5) placement of new mat foundation underneath remodel/addition areas; 6) and after-the-fact approval of 18-space surface parking lot, construction of 6 storage sheds within paved asphalt area totaling 1,623 sq.ft., and construction of 1,225 sq.ft. concrete slab patio with 2 trellises, at 201 Palisades Beach Rd., Santa Monica, Los Angeles County. item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: County of Santa Barbara LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-STB-17-0086-3 (Short-Term Rentals Ordinance)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the County of Santa Barbara’s request to amend the zoning ordinance to address vacation rentals (Short-Term Rentals and Home Stays) and to establish a Short-Term Rental Coastal Historic Overlay District. (MS-V)

subitem_title: City of Malibu LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-MAL-13-0241-1 (Affordable Housing Reasonable Accommodation) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for action for one year on City of Malibu’s request to amend the Local Implementation Plan portion of the certified LCP to create a “Affordable Housing Overlay,” add procedures related to reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities, and add provisions for housing density bonuses, farmworker employee housing, emergency shelters, single-room occupancies, small and large residential care facilities, transitional and supportive housing, and update housing-related definitions. (DV-V)

subitem_title: County of Santa Barbara LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-STB-16-0067-3 (Gaviota Coast Plan)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the County of Santa Barbara’s request to amend portions of the certified Local Coastal Program, including to amend the text and maps of the Land Use Plan to adopt the Gaviota Coast Plan and to amend the Coastal Zoning Ordinance to adopt new regulations to implement the Gaviota Coast Plan. (MW-V)

subitem_title: Ventura County Channel Islands Harbor Public Works Plan Notice of Impending Development CIH-NOID-0002-18 (Demolition of the Casa Sirena Hotel and Lobster Trap Restaurant and Construction of a New Hotel and Restaurant)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on Notice of Impending Development (NOID) by the Ventura County Harbor Department for demolition of the non-operational  and dilapidated 107,600 sq.ft., 45-ft. high, 184 room Casa Sirena Hotel and 5,400 sq.ft. Lobster Trap Restaurant and new construction consisting of: 203,011 sq.ft., 55-ft. high, 210 room hotel; 7,071 sq.ft. restaurant; 6,250 sq.ft. public plaza and promenade; and a total of 379 parking spaces at 3605 Peninsula Road, Channel Islands Harbor, Ventura County. (WH-V)

item_title: Items Th21a and Th 22a, below will share a combined presentation.

subitem_title: Port of Hueneme De Minimis PMP Amendment No. PMP-4-PHM-18-0003-1 (Deep Draft Berth Maintenance and Dredging)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the Oxnard Harbor District to amend its certified Port Master Plan to make minor revisions to allow for wharf maintenance, maintenance dredging, and deepening of the deep draft berths from -35 MLLW to -40 MLLW to facilitate continued use of the berths by deep water vessels. (JP-V)
